section_id: ## 6.3 Connection to Fragile Gas Phase Behavior

hints.label: prop-exploration-exploitation-curvature
hints.title: Exploration-Exploitation Transition
hints.content:
3023: :label: prop-exploration-exploitation-curvature
3024: 
3025: Consider the Adaptive Gas with fitness potential $V_{\text{fit}}(x) = -\alpha R(x) + \beta D(x, S)$ where:
3026: - $R(x)$: reward function
3027: - $D(x, S)$: diversity from swarm $S$
3028: - $\alpha, \beta$: weights
3029: 
3030: As $\beta/\alpha$ varies, the system undergoes a **continuous phase transition** from:
3031: - **Low $\beta/\alpha$**: Exploitation phase (swarm clusters on high-reward regions)
3032: - **High $\beta/\alpha$**: Exploration phase (swarm disperses for diversity)
3033: 
3034: The Ruppeiner curvature $R_{\text{Rupp}}(\alpha, \beta)$ exhibits a peak near the critical ratio:
3035: 
3036: $$
3037: \left(\frac{\beta}{\alpha}\right)_c \approx 1 + \frac{\lambda_v}{\sigma_v^2}
3038: $$
3039: 
3040: (from {prf:ref}`def-effective-temperature` in Chapter 7).

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-26
hints.content:
3045: :::{prf:proof}
3046: 
3047: **Step 1**: Map to thermodynamic variables.
3048: 
3049: - Temperature $T \leftrightarrow 1/\beta$ (inverse exploitation strength)
3050: - Volume $V \leftrightarrow$ effective search space
3051: - Entropy $S \leftrightarrow$ swarm diversity
3052: 
3053: **Step 2**: Fisher information at transition.
3054: 
3055: At the critical point, the QSD transitions from **unimodal** (exploitation) to **multimodal** (exploration). The Fisher information matrix detects this via:
3056: 
3057: $$
3058: g_{\text{Fisher}}^{\beta\beta} = \text{Var}_{\text{QSD}}(H_{\text{eff}}) \quad \text{(energy fluctuations)}
3059: $$
3060: 
3061: Multimodal distributions have **larger variance**, so:
3062: 
3063: $$
3064: g_{\text{Fisher}}^{\beta\beta} \text{ increases sharply near } \beta_c
3065: $$
3066: 
3067: **Step 3**: Pullback to Ruppeiner metric.
3068: 
3069: Via the coordinate transformation $(β, V, N) \to (U, V, N)$:
3070: 
3071: $$
3072: g_R = J^T g_{\text{Fisher}} J
3073: $$
3074: 
3075: The Jacobian has a singularity when $\partial U / \partial \beta$ is ill-defined (phase coexistence), leading to curvature divergence.
3076: 
3077: **Step 4**: Numerical verification.
